frameDefinitions: These words relate to the relative ordering of two events or times.
The word(s) in this frame detail a particular moment in time.
An Agent changes the filler of a  Role by placing a New filler in the position after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
A New filler occupies a Role or serves a Function after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
In this frame a Theme moves in a certain Direction which is often determined by gravity or other natural, physical forces.
Words in this frame name the different parts of the calendric cycle, both man-made and natural.
frameExamples: <t>After</t> she arrived , she laid out her papers on the desk.
If you <t>replace</t> me with a robot, who's gonna make excuses to your wife for you?
Jo's mother will visit on this coming <t>Tuesday</t>.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is the event which is  being located in time with respect to some other event: The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is profiled, in contrast to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>, which is backgrounded.
The <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen> is the event  with respect to which the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is located.
The <fen>Focal_participant</fen> is the participant in the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> which is profiled as being in a relation of relative time to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>.

The particular, salient point in time. If a specified time is present, it is the focal time. Otherwise, the unit is the focal time. If there is an appositive that specifies an entity that it not necessarily larger than the target, both the unit and the specification are the FE.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs actions resulting in the <fen>New</fen> entity occupying the position.
The <fen>New</fen> entity is the person or thing that the <fen>Agent</fen> sets to fill a <fen>Role</fen>.
The entity that formerly occupied the position.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> installs the New entity.
This role identifies where the <fen>Agent</fen> installs the <fen>New</fen> entity.
The new filler of the <fen>Role</fen> that was previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen> filler.
The category that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities fit into as a result of the <fen>Function</fen> they serve.
The (generally desirable) state of affairs that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities are involved in bringing about.
The entity that occupied the <fen>Role</fen> or served the <fen>Function</fen> before the <fen>New</fen> filler.
The time at which the <fen>New</fen> takes up the <fen>Role</fen> previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen>.
This role identifies the general <fen>Area</fen> in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up in (often unintentionally).
<fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels  or to a landmark past which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that changes location.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Theme</fen> occupies before the Motion occurs.
The direction of motion of the <fen>Theme</fen>.  <fen>Direction</fen> characterizes the <fen>Path</fen> of motion according to some system of orientation, most often that imposed by gravity.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Motion occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where motion specified by <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> occurs.
<fen>Relative_time</fen> is used for the word or words that locate the time with respect to an identifiable reference point.
<fen>Whole</fen> is used for the larger unit of which the target word names a part.
The calendric unit that is denoted. LUs in this frame all denote the <fen>Unit</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Hours of eating and drinking</fex> followed the wedding ceremony.
Hours of eating and drinking followed <fex>the wedding ceremony</fex>.
<fex>We</fex> were late for dinner.
I don't know; perhaps you could substitute <fex>regular sugar</fex>.
If you substitute a 15' arm <fex>for the 50cm one</fex>, it works pretty well.
The traditional thatched roof has often been replaced <fex>by corrugated galvanized iron</fex>.
What gas replaced Hydrogen <fex>as a safer medium for use in balloons</fex> on account it does not burn?
Oil and gas replaced coal <fex>in heating homes, in industry, and in transportation</fex>.
The electron was discovered and <fex>electricity</fex> replaced gas lamps.
When electricity replaced oil <fex>in the early 1930's</fex>, the steady beam was replaced by a flashing light.
Soot-contaminated snow falls <fex>in Slovakia's mountainous regions</fex>.
The rivals both fell backwards <fex>into empty space</fex>.
The boys plummeted <fex>down the stairs</fex> into the basement.
In 1977, <fex> Nigel</fex> plunged to his death in his car on a mountain road in southern France.
The man toppled <fex>from the passenger seat</fex> into the road.
I hope your egg does n't fall <fex>down</fex> .
<fex>In 1977</fex> Nigel plunged to his death in his car on a mountain road in southern France.
<fex>In the kitchen</fex>, the towel dropped onto the floor.
Jo's mother will visit <fex> this coming</fex> Tuesday.
Jo fled in the early morning <fex>of  Sunday December 15</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: “The Prisoners' Problem and the Subliminal Channel
